website_summaries.verdict: A solid poacher pan made from stainless steel and designed to last a long time.
pros: Cups large enough for jumbo sized eggs
Glass lid allows you to see eggs while they cook
cons: The stainless steel cups are not coated with a non-stick surface

customer_reviews.title: Great product but use caution storing it
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed using this product for a year and one half before the glass lid imploded. Fortunately it was in an enclosed cabinet because glass shards went everywhere. The lid should probably be stored slightly ajar to prevent a seal from forming.
customer_reviews.author: DStrong

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pan bc it is stainless steel and wanted to make poached eggs. The prodoct works pretty good for that purpose. Even with a lot of butter, ghee, or other oil, the eggs do become stuck easily. However, that is to be expected considering it is stainless steel, not stick-free. I actually like the pan so much, I remove the poacher part and use it as a basic pan. Verh pleased with this purchase considering I couldn't find another stainless steel poacher that didn't have all the chemicals associated with the non-stick pans.
customer_reviews.author: Prime member

customer_reviews.title: Guaranteed to Burn your Hand and your Fingers!
customer_reviews.text: While the advertising says it has a stay cool handle, I used this for the first time and burned the heck out of my hand picking it up. Next, the egg cups are impossible to empty because the plastic holders get so hot you can't pick the egg cups up until your eggs are cold. Very bad design. Loved the idea of having a nontoxic egg poaching pan but I will live without if it requires burning my hand and fingers each time I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie

customer_reviews.title: A dangerous piece of junk - literally dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This item had the glass top explode while poaching eggs. An explosion literally. Not sure where in china this thing was manufactured but do NOT buy it. It could take an eye out when it explodes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Poacher
customer_reviews.text: This poacher is excellent and I purchased a second one for my mother. The eggs slide out of the cups perfectly in the stainless steel. The little knob handles can get a little hot, but it's so much easier to remove the cups and the cup holder than trying to use tongs. The glass lid is a very nice feature. The pan is excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe Bordelon

customer_reviews.title: Cooks perfect eggs - but I question if bottom is stainless? It can't work with induction heaters
customer_reviews.text: Works well, produces perfect eggs - others said the eggs stick - baloney! Use a drop of Olive oil or butter - rub it around with a finger - eggs slip right out! DIDN"T like this - sold as Stainless Steel - IS IT? I question that as this won't work with my induction cooker, which requires steel or iron - ie magnetic - it reacts like its' aluminum to the induction system. What say you Mr/Mrs Manufacturer??
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: This is a great egg poacher. It's big, and it is all stainless steel -- none of that teflon junk. I've been using it for a few months now nearly every morning for breakfast. It cleans up very easily and looks great sitting on the stove. The only drawback, as others have noted, is the little black handles for each cup get really hot. No big deal, though; just let them cool a for a few minutes or use tongs or an oven mitt to take them out.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: This egg poacher pan is excellent!!! It is of heavy construction and very well made. An added bonus is that I have accidently left this pan with the inserts in the oven a couple of times when I turned it on and the plastic knobs did not melt with the heat!!!
customer_reviews.author: TruckerWoman

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This product has several useful features. First, it has a clear glass lid (not plastic). I like to watch the eggs to confirm readiness. Second, Each poaching port has an assist-lift out button for removal of the individual poached egg. I also like the size of the skillet. You can remove the poaching features and use the skillet for normal cooking. I was shopping for a stainless steel arrangement like this. The quality of build is very good, and by the way, the handle looks like it's attached in a way that will last for years. Conclusion, a high quality product that does all it is designed to do. It was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: gcbooks

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly poached eggs all day without Teflon taste. Auriiiigh
customer_reviews.text: Dislikes. Vent holes are right where you reach to grab the egg cups(not sure on terminology) makes for a sharp quick burn from time to time as a friendly reminder that life can be a prick. Other than that, I love these things. Helpful hint, Warm cups before greesing. Never an egg stuck that way.
customer_reviews.author: Jaycen Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I looked everywhere for an egg poacher that had stainless steel egg cups. All of the other products I looked at had some kind of synthetic surface—not good. The quality and size of this product is the perfect thing.
customer_reviews.author: G S

customer_reviews.title: low quality product
customer_reviews.text: Kind of disappointed with this for the price. It's stainless but very thin. While using, the handle gets very hot, and suggests not a very good design. Get's a solid 4/10
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Very good egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: I got this to avoid teflon. The positives are that it works great. Will do 5 eggs instead of the usual 4. Eggs don't stick with coconut oil. The negatives are that it's big, making storage a bit of an issue, and made in China. (I'm old and miss the 'made in USA') My old aluminum one with the teflon coated cups is history.
customer_reviews.author: dstrit

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: You won't go wrong with this set. My wife loves it. Very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Roc1

customer_reviews.title: Very surprised
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a stainless steel poached egg pan for years and this one is fabulous. The eggs cook fast and perfect everytime and the cups clean up beautifully. It's great to have 5 cups, too.I like the glass top so I can see the eggs cooking. There were directions on the box but not in the box so check that and write them down. I haven't used the pan itself for cooking other things and probably never will.I love this pan!!!!I thought the price was OK because I wanted stainless and not the dreaded teflon which we never use. What a great find!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thyme

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Used my new poacher to make eggs benedict for the family on Christmas morning. The eggs come out perfect, but picking up the individual egg dishes from the steaming pan is a bit tricky. There are small steam release holes between each egg cup making it difficult to remove the cups (with eggs inside) without burning fingers. Other than that, we are very happy with the set and thinking of purchasing a 2nd in order to cook more eggs at once. Only cooks 5 at one time, 6 or more would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Sue K. Fena

customer_reviews.title: Well, it cooks eggs.
customer_reviews.text: Does it poach eggs? Yes. Do the eggs stick? Yes, even with the cups well oiled. But anyone who has ever used stainless steel knows that sticking is usually an issue with stainless. I like this product, but compared to the stainless poaching set that I inherited, it's not anywhere near as sturdy. I expect that it will hold up just fine, but don't think it's going to become an heirloom. The plastic handles on the cups get HOT and cannot be used in a practical way. Given the other choices on the market however, I would certainly buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: I love this pan
customer_reviews.text: I love this pan. I actually use it to make hardboiled eggs (10mins for large eggs). We have our own chickens and fresh eggs, hardboiled are often hard to peel. No longer. They may be shaped a bit funny but eggs on our salads or egg salad has never been so easy. I use a bit of coconut oil in each egg dish, and reapply for the next batch and they slip right out!
customer_reviews.author: goatkeepers

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous stainless product
customer_reviews.text: This pan is extremely beautiful and sturdy. I love that I have 5 separate egg cups with NO NON STICK COATING!!!! I hate that stuff and searched for a while before I found this great pan. Using a little bit of oil or butter before cooking the eggs in the cups allows for easier removal. I love this egg poacher!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette R. Liska

customer_reviews.title: From what I could tell it looks like a nice product
customer_reviews.text: In all fairness, I have to preface this by saying I bought but have not used this egg poacher. From what I could tell it looks like a nice product. My problem is I have an induction cooktop and it won't work with it. Not sure why this is as it's made of stainless steel and a magnet will stick to it. But it didn't work so it's going back.
customer_reviews.author: Greg P

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pan
customer_reviews.text: I had never made poached eggs before and after having a delicious breakfast at a restaurant, I decided to make them at home. The pan is very well made and sturdy. My only challenge was to get the little cups out of the pan without either dropping the egg or burning my fingers. Using tongs was the way to go but a better design would make things easier or handles that do not heat up if that is at all possible!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Best Egg Poacher Available
customer_reviews.text: I have used many egg poachers and this is, in my, opinion the best one you can find. It literally poaches eggs to perfection. All you need to do is spray the cups with some organic cooking oil and rub it around or use organic coconut oil. Then when the eggs are done just grab a cup by the handle, with a kitchen towel as it is a bit warm, then tilt the cup over and tap it on your plate and the eggs easily slip out. They are perfectly shaped and taste great. Clean up is a breeze as well. Worth every dime!
customer_reviews.author: W. B. Weston

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: The Norpro stainless egg poacher produced perfect poached eggs on my first attempt. I placed 3 cups water in the pan, placed it on the stove with moderate flame. Egg cups left out cool while the water came to boil. I fingered butter into the cool cups, cracked an egg into four of them, then using the handy round knob placed the cool cup with egg into the slot in the pan. Place the lid on.and in about 6 minutes removed cup with the cooked egg one by one and simply tipped them (slowly) into a bowl. They all just slid out nicely. No scraping or fuss. It don't get any better than this.
customer_reviews.author: ELMER

customer_reviews.title: nice cooking, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: was very sharp edged , cut my finger on the holder of the cups first wash. very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Norpro egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: You still need a tad of oil, butter, spray to not stick but I expected that. I bring my water to boil with out cups, coat very sparenly with coconut oil, put in cups in tray, break eggs into and cover. 4 min in boiling tray is a perfect egg. To remove I use a potholder, drain the water off the little cup, run a soft spatula around the edge and turn it over into a plate. I have never had one stick doing this. I researched all egg poachers and this is the ONLY stainless steel one I found that would not leach chemicals from the nonstick coating.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Ward

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, works very well
customer_reviews.text: I only poach one egg per day in this,... but it works perfectly. I only had to experiment with cooking time at first.. bring to boil, reduce heat, put a couple of drops of olive oil in the cup & spread to cover all the cup's inside surface... put egg in the cup, put the cup in the pan and cover for 5:30,... perfect poached egg. only thing, don't forget the bit of oil, the egg will stick.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Guilbeau

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived as stated well packaged and in great shape. I have looked for a poacher with stainless cups for years and was thrilled to find this one. The handle is spot welded to the pan and appears to posibly be a future problem but over all the poacher works fantastic. The poached eggs slide right out of the cups with no assistance at all. Overall it is well designed and has exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: No more toxic smell on my eggs.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a brand name an egg poacher from a local kitchen and bath store. The egg cups were made of plastic and the first time I used it there was a toxic smell when I removed the top. The egg had a strange taste. It was an American company but the product was made in China. I never poached an egg since. Then I purchased the Norpro Krona. The cups are made of stainless steel and the grips are bakelite. The cups are easy to clean and there's no toxic smell when you poach an egg.
customer_reviews.author: Willco

customer_reviews.title: The kids love them too
customer_reviews.text: It's worth the high price to me for a true stainless poacher without the poison nonstick coating. I have used almost daily since getting it, making poached eggs over toast. The kids love them too, I wish I would have bought it sooner, a man can only eat so many omelets, this lets me enjoy my eggs another whey...
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Fun

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Very thin pot that bends easily if you're not careful.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Perfection in egg poaching
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the best egg poacher I have ever used. When you handle this product, you can instantly tell that this was manufactured with quality in mind. And, as long as you remember to grease the cups, it produces perfect poached eggs every time. The glass lid is a welcome extra (included in the set), as you can watch as the egg cooks, and determine when you wish to take if out. I am very impressed with this product, and recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: Skyhawk

customer_reviews.title: This pan is NOT made in the USA , as adnertised ! It's made in China !
customer_reviews.text: I dislike ( and disliked ) the fact that the round handles on the egg cups get ( got ) very hot and as a result they made ( make ) it very difficult to get the egg cups out of the pan when the eggs are cooked ! Safety Hazard !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard  M.Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best poacher I ever had
customer_reviews.text: I had gotten so tired of the non-stick kind that always ends up sticking and didn't even make poached eggs because I don't like to spend forever cleaning them and though this is expensive it is well worth it if you want to be able to cook eggs and not have them stick. All I did was rub the cups with margarine and put the eggs in and absolutely NO sticking, came out so nice and it is good quality you can tell. Just love it and family does too!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Poached eggs the easy way
customer_reviews.text: Excellent method for perfect poached eggs. My eggs benedict never looked better.
customer_reviews.author: Don R. Peltonen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this egg cooker ! Definitely feels safe to use it and easy and no problems at all !
customer_reviews.author: Reviews R Helpful

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous cookware
customer_reviews.text: I've tried, and worn out or destroyed, no less than 4 other, less expensive, egg poachers, including the one with the plastic egg cups that gives you rubbery eggs. This one is well worth the extra money spent--it is well designed and sturdy. The knobs at the ends of the egg cups are welded on, not screwed. Unlike other models with black-painted egg cups, the stainless steel cups of the Krona released the cooked eggs easily if they were sprayed with PAM and cleaned up effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: Eggzackly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: The pan is very sturdy and I like that it has a glass lid. It cleans easly as do the little egg holders. I use it several times a week. It takes about 6 minutes to do an egg and if you use pam they come right out of the holders. The only bad thing I can say is that I thought it was for 4 eggs but when I got it, it had 5 egg cups. A little larger than I wanted but still I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Great poacher!
customer_reviews.text: I have not purchased a Norpro product before and honestly have never heard of it. I am very pleased with the sturdy weight of the pan compared to another one I have from Williams Sonoma. While the pan is still lightweight for ease of use, it is still a heavier pan. I love that you can cook 5 poached eggs versus 4 in my other pan. The pans insert is removable and the parts are easily cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Louise MacIlvane

customer_reviews.title: nibble fingers work best
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job poaching eggs. I would have given it five stars except for the small black knob on the thing. They are round, smallish and hot when using the poacher making somewhat difficult to adroitly removed the egg cups without being burned. There is an acquired knack to to using the poacher in that regard. Sorry, there is a bit of a learning curve to using the thing. Otherwise it is a great item to have if you liked poached eggs and I do.
customer_reviews.author: horace "com1, irq4"

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and beautiful cookware. always used a microwave poacher and could never get the eggs done to the degree that I wanted. with this, you can see the eggs cook and their degree of being done. perfect poached eggs. individual egg trays can be a little warm once eggs are done cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: time arriving
customer_reviews.text: Item was send fast and is as described by sell. Will buy again from you.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Oberholster

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you have spagetti tongs to remove the cups or you will no longer have finger prints
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing poached egg pan
customer_reviews.text: We just got this product and cannot stop using it. I would make successful poached eggs 50% of the time, and now it’s 100% of the time. So easy to use and my husband and son love the eggs!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Zats

customer_reviews.title: I love this. If you apply a thin coat of ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this. If you apply a thin coat of oil or butter eggs do not stick. I found that if I use a paper towel to spread the oil eggs do stick. I started using my finger and it made all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Look no further....
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good stainless steel egg poacher, your search ends here. The quality is excellent, though priced little high. But, the pan can double up as frying / saute pan, which compensates the price,to some extent. My kids love the eggs poached on this and cooking happens very fast.
customer_reviews.author: S. K. pinna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Boils really fast and cups release eggs well. Heavy pot/lid and all made very well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best poacher! You get what you pay for. Does 5 Jumbo eggs at once!
customer_reviews.text: Quality product. You can buy a cheaper poacher but if you appreciate the BEST...buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Ray Lucas

customer_reviews.title: This is a great stainless steel pan we use for frying and stir-fry
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stainless steel pan we use for frying and stir-fry, not just poaching. Handle is a little bit weak where it is welded to pan, so don't lift the pan by only the handle if pan is full.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We love this pan. Now my husband even makes his own breakfast . . . haha. Very sturdy and easy to use. We do spray the cups first with Pam or equivalent for easy cleanup -
customer_reviews.author: fast and fun.  enjoying it immensely

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I have ever purchased online, the cups tipover from the wieght of the "knobs" making it necessary to unscrew the knobs and put them in the drawer. Pliers for removing the hot cups are now part of the morning ritual.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Geiser

customer_reviews.title: Norpro Stainless Steel 10 inch Egg Poacher Skillet Set
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses the egg poacher frequently. Works as well as it is attractive. Easy to clean the stainless using Bar Keepers Friend. The handle stays cool to touch. And the egg cups are easy to handle. Still looks new after 1 1/2 years.
customer_reviews.author: New Balance WW1200 walking

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I haven't found a way to coat the cups so that the egg residue washes easily. The eggs cook perfectly though. I would definitely recommend this item, just be prepared to use a little elbow grease when cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: MorningGlory

customer_reviews.title: The pan works well on it's own but I've had better pans at half the price
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. A pain to clean the poaching parts. The pan works well on it's own but I've had better pans at half the price. I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: watergirl56

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was looking for when I ordered this pan. I was not disapointed. I came well packaged and with an outstanding finish on the pan...very impressive. I used the pan to cook my poached eggs and it worked great. The depth of the sides makes it handy for many uses. Well worth the money spent....would recommend it for anyone's kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ray Towns

customer_reviews.title: Egg poacher works great.
customer_reviews.text: The poacher is easy to use and easy to clean. I had a teflon poacher insert before and the eggs always were sticking to it. Also I felt uneasy about using teflon. The Norpro has removable egg cups for easy cleaning. I use them with a small amount of butter. After cooking the eggs slide out onto my toast with no help needed. It is such a different, and better, experience. It is new (to me) but I look forward to using it a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Egg Cooker
customer_reviews.text: This so far is an excellent egg poacher. If you want to get away from teflon cooking surfaces, this is the way to go. Cooks eggs perfectly every time, and they taste better than when made on teflon previously. Easy clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: Great pan for poaching eggs!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pan is great quality, very heavy. Easy to use and looks good. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: alan nelson

customer_reviews.title: Egg poacher
customer_reviews.text: Best egg poacher for home/family use. Stainless removable cups are great. You can do 1 or 5 if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS ADVERTISED !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Specifications declare stainless steel but box indicates that pan has ALUMINUM center ??? Stay cool handle is only the pan handle, not the Cover handle or the insert cups handle. This should be specified in the description !!!!! Are these omissions on purpose to misrepresent the product ?? I think so !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dina rosen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent all stainless steel even the cups, enjoy a healthy way to cook great eggs.
customer_reviews.author: enjoying life

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product. Compared to others I looked at, this one cooks 5 at a time, which was a big selling point for me. Definitely have to spray a little cooking oil in each poacher. Good size and good design so it easily fits into my cabinet when not in use. So glad this is the one I chose!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this one. Just be sure to put enough butter or oil in cups so no sticking.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Barbieri

customer_reviews.title: Works and cooks great. Best poached eggs I've ever tasted
customer_reviews.text: No problems. Works and cooks great. Best poached eggs I've ever tasted. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Desertfox

customer_reviews.title: Awsome. Best egg poacher I have ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this many times the past year and love it! cooks to perfections. Easy clean up and durable. Must buy if you want perfect poached eggs.
customer_reviews.author: flyguy

customer_reviews.title: Very worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fan of this pan because, (duh), it's stainless steel! No aluminum for me, thank you very much. Performs very well, eggs come out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wayman

customer_reviews.title: Best we found.
customer_reviews.text: Poaches eggs beautifully. Very happy with this purchase a year later.
customer_reviews.author: GF

customer_reviews.title: does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I put bacon grease on it cold and the eggs come out easily. It also works to put a little butter in to melt, swirl it around and then add the egg. I cook them about 4 minutes and they come out perfect! The black knobs do get a bit hot; I just lift them out quickly to a cutting board close by. The cups come clean in the dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: granita

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great poacher. Still working on how to stop the eggs sticking in the poaching cups though.
customer_reviews.author: Kwik.Pixel

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pan
customer_reviews.text: An attractive set. However, the knobs on the egg cups get quite hot as the eggs cook so you'll need tongs or a pot holder to lift them out when the eggs are done.
customer_reviews.author: SallyG

customer_reviews.title: My wife wanted to see a expensive egg poacher looks like. I like it and she felt it was ...
customer_reviews.text: just got my Norpro 10" egg poacher. My wife wanted to see a expensive egg poacher looks like. I like it and she felt it was indeed well made and if you like poaching eggs this will do the job and then some. I have to figure out how to keep a little egg from sticking in the cups. Minor issue. P.H.D
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dinger

customer_reviews.title: I love my poacher!
customer_reviews.text: This one of the best purchases I have ever made, and I am 72, it is absolutely great for an early morning egg and so easy to clean and use, you must grease (use coconut oil) the entire inside of the little dishes or they will take you some time to clean, 5 star for sure!!! John Wilkie
customer_reviews.author: John Wilkie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Poached eggs are evenly cooked and like the clear lid.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Dreger

customer_reviews.title: Upon arrival the skillet had a scratch in the inside ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon arrival the skillet had a scratch in the inside bottom of the pan. Hope this will not cause food to stick (when not using the poaching inserts).
customer_reviews.author: L Clifford

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, nicely weighted. Looks like its going to last a long time. Love that the cups are stainless WITHOUT the non-stick coating. Eggs come out easily and cook evenly. So much better than microwaving or slipping an egg in hot water.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Norpro 5 egg poacher skillet set
customer_reviews.text: Positively the best egg poacher I have tried. Coat the individual cups with coconut oil, put in eggs, and set the 5-cupholder in pan after pan is boiling. Cook for 7 minutes. Perfect eggs every time. Eggs fall out of the cups, no sticking. Cups easily hold jumbo eggs withabout 1/8 inch to spare. JB
customer_reviews.author: J Borochoff MD

customer_reviews.title: it does the job well
customer_reviews.text: This is the only egg poacher I could find that was solid stainless and not coated with the nonstick stuff. I does the job very well, but I felt that it was a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Fajdiga

customer_reviews.title: Love this egg poacher.
customer_reviews.text: I have been hunting for a large egg poaching pan for sometime, and this one is perfect. I just use cooking spray in each of the cups, and the eggs slide right out. Clean up is super easy.
customer_reviews.author: walsh256

customer_reviews.title: Great Bit Of Kit!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this one because it was the only one I could find that was ALL Stainless steel!! Easy to clean. Much more healthy to cook with than Aluminium or Teflon!! The Pan can also be used on its own for other cooking tasks. Its very well made, will probably never have to buy another in My lifetime. Well Happy!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly priced product that works alot better then the other "non-stick" products. very easy to clean and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: nd

customer_reviews.title: Good  and versitle
customer_reviews.text: Can use for other things and cook many or one or two eggs at a time. Little pricey but will last long time
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W. Swerline

customer_reviews.title: the eggs come out clean and perfect.
customer_reviews.text: As long as a little Pam olive spray is used, the eggs come out clean and perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jmalmo

customer_reviews.title: qualityegg paocher
customer_reviews.text: No non-stick coated utensils for us, so this was the perfect choice when we wanted a quality egg poacher. With a little olive oil the poached eggs slide right out of the mini pans and the clear glass lid allows us to see when they are done to our liking. Would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: MandM

customer_reviews.title: wife loves it
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it; it's not aluminum which is important to us and has a clear glass cover so you can see what's going on, it's easy to clean, it's attractive looking, it can be used as a saute or fry pan as well, and it cooks five eggs so we each get two and our dog gets one, and the price is fair. We're very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: howhoo

customer_reviews.title: Great Stainless Steel Egg Poacher
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find an all stainless steel egg poacher. This one is perfect! I would recommend this item for poached egg lovers. Before getting this item, I dropped the eggs directly into the boiling water with very mixed results and messy clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart S.

customer_reviews.title: it's ok, I washed it before I used it ...
customer_reviews.text: it's ok, I washed it before I used it but it still made the bottom of the eggs gray when I cooked them the first time. so I washed it again with a sos pad and then in the dishwasher and they were finr then.
customer_reviews.author: Dee S.

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My mother requested one for her birthday. I did a lot of research and ended up with this one. She loves it and says it is no fail.
customer_reviews.author: Long Island, Ny

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: looks great - and seems to be well made -
customer_reviews.author: bjm

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice.
customer_reviews.text: After months of not having poached eggs the family can finally have them again. Love the fact its not coated cups and stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Egg Poacher Success
customer_reviews.text: Egg poacher pan works perfectly. Do need to add a little butter or oil to cups prior to putting in eggs - eggs will just slide out. It is also quite easily cleaned. The skillet with glass lid is also a nice, quality addition to pans I already have.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great egg poacher - no teflon
customer_reviews.text: All stainless steel, no teflon. Other teflon poachers eventually scrape off into your food. Eggs slide out - no stick, just make sure the water is boiling and the cups are already hot when you add the butter and eggs. It's great for family breakfasts with the 5 cups. The best egg poacher I've owned!
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Poacher!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this poacher and am so pleased with it. It is well made and has some weight to it. The cups are also stainless and very little egg is left when you remove the egg. Definitely recommended to anyone looking for a well made poacher.
customer_reviews.author: Shane E.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Egg Poacher
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Napro Krona 10-inche Egg Poacher Skillet Set for my Mom. She loves it everytime using it. She said it's wonderful. Plus the service is great. Fast free shipping. Well protect. I love Amazon.com. Always happy anytime I place an order with Amazon.com. Thank Amazon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lena Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product, and the designers chose just the right materials for its construction. The nylon knobs stay cool. The stainless steel cups cook the eggs just right. We've tried a few egg poachers in the past, including a microwave version, and this Norpro 5-egg poacher is simply the best. We love it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pan not knowing what to expect. The pan has good weight to it and as long as you give the cups a little swirl of butter or olive oil, the eggs come right out without leaving a mess. Takes a few times to get the eggs just right but now that I have it down pat.......I am 100% happy.
customer_reviews.author: G. Romeos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Heats evenly. Made well and clean up is a cinch!!!! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: HIgh Desert Gal

customer_reviews.title: Eggs Stick
customer_reviews.text: Even though the cups were throughly oiled, the eggs still stuck. The little knobs attached to the egg cups got very hot and wet so it was difficult to remove them from the insert, even with a potholder. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: THE PAN IS GREAT BUT THE KNOBS TO PICK UP THE POACHERS ARE HORRIBLE, THEY BURN YOUR HAND AND ARE DIFFICULT TO PICK UP, NEEDS A BETTER DESIGN
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN B.

customer_reviews.title: Great pan set
customer_reviews.text: We love this pan. It is well constructed and makes perfect poached eggs. We bought another one for a gift and they love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Harper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The egg poaching pan is just great. It arrived nicely packaged, clean and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Frances Finn

customer_reviews.title: Norpro Stainless Steel 10 inch Egg Poacher skillet set
customer_reviews.text: Was so pleased to find this skillet egg poacher. Could never find it in the stores. It is very good quality and makes egg poaching very easy. Very good product and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Hau-lepera

product_meta.title: Norpro Stainless Steel Egg Poacher/Skillet Set, 10", Silver
product_meta.description:
Measures: 5.5" x 17.75" x 10"/ 14cm x 45cm x 25.5Cm
Pan measures: 10"/ 25.5Cm
Handle measures: 8"/ 20cm
Cups measures: 3"/ 7.5Cm
Easy to make delicious poached eggs! stainless steel with 5 removable egg poacher cups. Pan may be used separately as a fry pan/saute skillet. Has a TRI-PLY ENCAPSULATED base that incorporates 2 layers of stainless steel with an aluminum core layer. This solid construction ensures: increased heat conductivity, even heat distribution, increased cooking efficiency, protection from hot spots and burning and reliable durability. Includes a tempered glass vented lid and stay-cool handle designed for safety, comfort and durability. Hand washing recommended.

Norpro was founded in 1973 with a vision to design, manufacture, and supply the highest caliber kitchenware. Norpro’s offering of innovative, high quality product for cooking, preparing and serving food are produced with superior materials and craftsmanship.
feature_bullets: Easy to make delicious poached eggs!
Stainless steel with 5 removable egg poacher cups.
Pan may be used separately as a fry pan/saute skillet.
Has a TRI-PLY ENCAPSULATED base that incorporates 2 layers of stainless steel with an aluminum core layer.
This solid construction ensures:  increased heat conductivity, even heat distribution, increased cooking efficiency, protection from hot spots and burning and reliable durability.
Includes a tempered glass vented lid and stay-cool handle designed for safety, comfort and durability.
Included components: Egg Poacher Pan, Egg cups, Lid

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
